questions.question: What does the acronym "DOM" stand for in JavaScript?
How do you declare a variable in JavaScript?
What is the purpose of the addEventListener method?
answers: To create a new HTML element
To attach an event handler to an element
To modify the CSS styles of an element
To fetch data from an API
questions.correctAnswer: To attach an event handler to an element

questions.question: Which operator is used for strict equality comparison in JavaScript?
What does the typeof operator return for an array?
How can you create a new array by extracting specific elements from an existing array?
What is the difference between null and undefined in JavaScript?
answers: They are equivalent and can be used interchangeably
null represents an empty object, while undefined represents an uninitialized variable
null is a primitive value, while undefined is an object
There is no difference; they both mean the same thing
questions.correctAnswer: null represents an empty object, while undefined represents an uninitialized variable

questions.question: How do you iterate over the elements of an array using a for...of loop?
What is the purpose of the map method in JavaScript?
answers: To create a new array with modified elements
To filter out specific elements from an array
To sort an array in ascending order
questions.correctAnswer: To create a new array with modified elements
